DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if an assigned physical fitness program will result in weight loss to prepare patients for kidney transplant.
DOC.brief_title: Preparing for Kidney Transplant by Attaining a Healthy Weight
DOC.detailed_description: The goal of this study is to prepare subjects for kidney transplant. Patients who are in need of a kidney transplant but are unable to be place on the wait list due to weight will be enrolled in a six month workout program. The workout program will consist of counseling from a registered dietician, personal training from certified trainers and constant health monitoring.
DOC.criteria: Adult patients over 18 years of age and older but less than 65 All patients who are currently listed as "inactive" on the University of Chicago kidney transplant wait list Those with a body mass index of 4044 Those with access to the Internet Have transportation to the fitness center (Formula Fitness Center at Union Station location) Those patients who are listed "inactive" on the waitlist due to comorbid conditions other than obesity Those who are unwilling to attend fitness center appointments Those who do not have adequate transportation to the fitness center Those who do not have access to the Internet Those who are not comfortable navigating and using the Internet
